questiontext.text:
Solve the following matrix multiplication for A (using inverse):

$$\small BA = I$$

where $$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}2 &8 \\11 &19\end{pmatrix}\:$$

and $$\small I = \begin{pmatrix}1 & 0 \\0 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\:$$

Calculate upto 3 significant figures

A =   
{1:NUMERICAL:=-0.38:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}{1:NUMERICAL:=0.16:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.22:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}{1:NUMERICAL:=-0.04:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
Given the following equation :

$$\small BA = I$$

Pre-Multiplying B-1 on both sides, we get :

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(2)(19) - (8)(19)}\begin{bmatrix}19 &-8 \\-11 &2 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}-0.38 &0.16 \\0.22 &-0.04 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =-0.38$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =0.16$$
$$\small a_{21} =0.22$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =-0.04$$

where $$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}-1 &6 \\14 &-17\end{pmatrix}\:$$

and $$\small I = \begin{pmatrix}1 & 0 \\0 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\:$$

Calculate upto 3 significant figures

A =   
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.25373:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}{1:NUMERICAL:=0.089552:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.20896:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}{1:NUMERICAL:=0.014925:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
Given the following equation :

$$\small BA = I$$

Pre-Multiplying B-1 on both sides, we get :

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(-1)(-17) - (6)(-17)}\begin{bmatrix}-17 &-6 \\-14 &-1 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}0.25373 &0.089552 \\0.20896 &0.014925 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =0.25373$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =0.089552$$
$$\small a_{21} =0.20896$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =0.014925$$

{1:NUMERICAL:=0.22642:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}{1:NUMERICAL:=0.018868:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
Given the following equation :

$$\small BA = I$$

Pre-Multiplying B-1 on both sides, we get :

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(-1)(-19) - (6)(-19)}\begin{bmatrix}-19 &-6 \\-12 &-1 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}0.35849 &0.11321 \\0.22642 &0.018868 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =0.35849$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =0.11321$$
$$\small a_{21} =0.22642$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =0.018868$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(1)(16) - (-7)(16)}\begin{bmatrix}16 &7 \\11 &1 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(-5)(-17) - (-9)(-17)}\begin{bmatrix}-17 &9 \\12 &-5 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}0.73913 &-0.3913 \\-0.52174 &0.21739 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =0.73913$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =-0.3913$$
$$\small a_{21} =-0.52174$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =0.21739$$

Pre-Multiplying B-1 on both sides, we get :

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(-4)(-19) - (6)(-19)}\begin{bmatrix}-19 &-6 \\-14 &-4 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}2.375 &0.75 \\1.75 &0.5 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =2.375$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =0.75$$
$$\small a_{21} =1.75$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =0.5$$

generalfeedback.text:
Given the following equation :

$$\small BA = I$$

Pre-Multiplying B-1 on both sides, we get :

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(-3)(-16) - (-8)(-16)}\begin{bmatrix}-16 &8 \\13 &-3 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}0.28571 &-0.14286 \\-0.23214 &0.053571 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =0.28571$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =-0.14286$$
$$\small a_{21} =-0.23214$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =0.053571$$
